head.title: Webb and 8 Others Play in Benefit

hedline.hl1: Webb and 8 Others Play in Benefit

abstract.p: Karrie Webb and eight other LPGA players take part in first Karrie Webb celebrity pro-am at Manhattan Woods Golf Club, West Nyack, NY, to benefit Christopher Reeve Paralysis Foundation (M)

block.p: Karrie Webb and eight other L.P.G.A. players took part yesterday in the first Karrie Webb celebrity pro-am at Manhattan Woods Golf Club in West Nyack, N.Y., to benefit the Christopher Reeve Paralysis Foundation.
Webb initiated the event because her Australian teacher, Kevin Haller, has been confined to a wheelchair, like Reeve, for the last 10 years.

Karrie Webb and eight other L.P.G.A. players took part yesterday in the first Karrie Webb celebrity pro-am at Manhattan Woods Golf Club in West Nyack, N.Y., to benefit the Christopher Reeve Paralysis Foundation.
Webb initiated the event because her Australian teacher, Kevin Haller, has been confined to a wheelchair, like Reeve, for the last 10 years.

Webb met Reeve, the actor who portrayed Superman, last year and they decided to stage a charity event annually at Manhattan Woods on the Monday before the Japan Airlines Big Apple Classic because many L.P.G.A. players would be in the New York area for the tournament, which begins Friday at Wykagyl Country Club in New Rochelle, N.Y.
Reeve was on hand yesterday as 72 amateurs joined the nine L.P.G.A. players for a round. The event included an exhibition by the players, an awards dinner and a celebrity auction.
